<JD_START>
Job Title: Director of Residence Life- Community Manager

Location: Santa Rosa, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Education, Training

Description:
Director of Residence Life - 352 Beds of First-Time Student HousingServitas Management Group, LLC (SMG) and Santa Rosa Junior College (SRJC) have formed a unique partnership focused on providing an excellent living experience for Students attending SRJC in Santa Rosa, CA. SMG believes that the right Director of Residence Life will be instrumental to the success of this partnership and the opening of the first on-campus housing community.Founded in 1918, SRJC's 100+-acre Santa Rosa Campus, located 52 miles north of San Francisco, is one of the most beautiful campuses in California's 108-campus community college system and is largely characterized by elegant turn-of-the-century ivy-covered brick buildings, towering oak trees, flower gardens and manicured lawns in a park-like setting in the heart of Santa Rosa. In addition to its state-of-the-art classroom facilities, laboratories, and conference-winning athletic programs, the campus houses a Planetarium, an Art Gallery, Summer Repertory Theatre, and the Jesse Peter Native American Museum.The primary responsibility of the Director of Residence Life is to provide leadership and direction for the business affairs, facility management, and Residence Life activities for Santa Rosa Junior College's first-time housing (352 Beds opening in August of 2023). The leasing center is open to all interested students. In addition, our team members work to ensure a consistent, positive living environment in close cooperation with SRJC.Responsibilities include:· Communication and liaison with NCCD, LLC, and SRJC· Hiring, training, and supervision of professional staff· Monitoring of Operations and capital budget· collection of housing fees and delinquencies· Administering housing assignments and lease enforcement· Supervision of facility maintenance· Development of marketing plans along with marketing and leasing materials· Developing and implementing the Residence Life program· Management of contracts with outside vendors.An ideal candidate will have strong experience in the following:· Facilities management/maintenance· Capital planning· Accounts receivables/payables.Excellent verbal and written communication skills are needed to interact with campus partners, students, families, and community members. Effective time management, attention to detail, and managing competing priorities will be necessary for success. In addition, the candidate will devote themselves to supporting the academic mission of the new student community and diligently work towards meeting the four strategic objectives of this project.· Affordability for Students· Sustainable Facilities & PracticesFocus on the Student ExperienceUse of Local Labor & Delivered On TimeAn Ideal Candidate supports and maintains a living environment that is inclusive, open, anti-racist, and adheres to the college's anti-discrimination statement: The Sonoma County Junior College District does not discriminate on the basis of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, ethnic group identification, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic condition, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information or sexual orientation in any of its policies, procedures or practices (SCJCD Board Policy 8.21).· A Bachelor's degree is required. Master's Preferred.· Demonstrated experience in college student housing, administration, customer service, and supervision.· All candidates will participate in a background check and drug screening before employment.· Compensation package: Based on relevant experience, excellent benefits, including medical, dental, 401K, and professional development funding, are available.· Job Type: Full-time· Pay: $78,000 -$85,000 commensurate with experience· Potential Live-On Option AvailableCOVID-19 considerations:Must comply with regulations of Santa Rosa Junior CollegeSMG is an industry leader managing on-campus student housing for non-profit owners and higher education institutions. Along with our campus partners, we implement and support custom management programs that best reflect the educational philosophy and goals of the institution. Our management team members have experience working on-campus, and most have a degree in higher education, student affairs, business, or social services. We take pride in developing close relationships with our campus colleagues, pursuing excellence, and providing remarkable service.Job Type: Full-timePay: $75,000.00 - $85,000.00 per yearBenefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFlexible spending accountHealth insuranceHealth savings accountLife insurancePaid time offRelocation assistanceRetirement planVision insuranceSchedule:Monday to FridayWork setting:Live-inEducation:Bachelor's (Required)Experience:Student Housing: 4 years (Required)Ability to Relocate:Santa Rosa, CA 95401: Relocate before starting work (Required)Work Location: In person

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
